title: Walking in Truth and Love
shortSummary: 2 John is a brief epistle emphasizing the importance of abiding in the truth of Christ, loving one another according to God's commandments, and guarding against deceivers who deny Jesus Christ's incarnation. The elder encourages steadfastness in doctrine and warns against false teachers, highlighting the necessity of discernment and obedience in the Christian walk.
timeline: c. AD 85-95 - Late first century, during the apostolic era when early churches faced challenges from false teachers denying Christ's true nature

keyCharacters.name: The Elder
keyCharacters.description: The author of the letter, traditionally identified as the Apostle John, who writes to encourage and warn the elect lady and her children.

keyCharacters.name: The Elect Lady
keyCharacters.description: The recipient of the letter, likely a metaphor for a local church and its members, referred to as beloved in the truth.

keyCharacters.name: Deceivers (Antichrists)
keyCharacters.description: False teachers who deny Jesus Christ came in the flesh, posing a threat to the church's purity and doctrine.

keyCharacters.name: The Children of the Elect Sister
keyCharacters.description: Fellow believers who send greetings, indicating a network of faithful Christians connected to the elect lady.

definitions.definition: A title used for a church leader or apostle, here likely referring to John, emphasizing authority and pastoral care.
Chosen by God for salvation, indicating those who belong to the true faith.
One who denies the incarnation of Jesus Christ and opposes the true gospel, embodying deception and opposition to Christ.
The teaching concerning the person and work of Jesus Christ, including His incarnation, death, and resurrection.
A greeting or expression of goodwill; here it warns against endorsing false teachers by welcoming them or encouraging their mission.

outline.heading: Greeting and Affirmation of Truth and Love
outline.description: The elder addresses the elect lady and her children, expressing joy over their faithfulness to the truth and emphasizing the commandment to love one another as foundational to Christian living.

outline.heading: Warning Against Deceivers and Antichrists
outline.description: A solemn warning is given about false teachers who deny Christ’s incarnation, urging believers to guard their faith, reject such deceivers, and avoid supporting their evil deeds.

outline.heading: Personal Remarks and Final Greetings
outline.description: The elder expresses his desire to visit personally to share joy face to face and sends greetings from the children of the elect sister, concluding the letter with a blessing.

application: Commit daily to walking in the truth of God’s Word, ensuring your faith aligns with biblical doctrine.
Demonstrate genuine love by obeying God’s commandments, especially loving fellow believers as Christ commanded.
Be vigilant against false teachings by testing all doctrine against Scripture and refusing to support those who deny Christ’s true nature.
Seek fellowship with mature believers and encourage one another in faith to maintain spiritual health and joy.

keyVerses.text: And this is love, that we walk after his commandments. This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.
keyVerses.significance: This verse defines true love as obedience to God's commandments, emphasizing the inseparable link between love and holiness.

keyVerses.text: For many deceivers are entered into the world, who confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh. This is a deceiver and an antichrist.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the critical heresy of denying Christ’s incarnation and identifies such teachers as antichrists, warning believers to be discerning.

keyVerses.text: Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not God. He that abideth in the doctrine of Christ, he hath both the Father and the Son.
keyVerses.significance: This verse stresses the necessity of holding firmly to the true teaching about Christ to maintain fellowship with God.
